gurmukhi: ieh BwNq kIXo idv rwj rwj ]BMfwr Bry suB srb swj ]
transliteration: Ih Bhaant Keeyo Div Raaj Raaj|| Bhandaar Bhare Soubh Sarab Saaj||
translation: In this way, Indra, the king of gods ruled and filled the granaries of materials through all modes;

gurmukhi: jb dyvqwn biFXo grUr ]blvMq dYq au`Ty krUr ]1]
transliteration: Jab Devtaan Badhiyo Daroor|| Balvant Dait Outthe Daroor||1
translation: When the pride of the gods grew enormously, then in order toshelve their pride, the hard-hearted mighty demons rose again.1.

gurmukhi: il`no iCnwie idv rwj rwj ]bwij`qR nyk auTy su bwj ]
transliteration: Linno Chhinaae Div Raaj Raaj|| Baajittra Nek Outhe Su Baaj||
translation: The kingdom of Indra was seized and this proclamation was made on all sides with the accompaniment of many musical instruments,

gurmukhi: ieh BwNiq jgq dohI iPrwie ]jlM bw QlyAM ihrnwCrwie ]2]
transliteration: Eh Bhaant(i) Jagad Dohiphiraae|| Jalan Baa Thalean Hirnaachh-raae||2||
translation: That Hiranayakashipu is the emperor at all the places.2.

gurmukhi: iek dXos gXo inj nwir qIr ]sij su`D swj inj AMg bIr ]
transliteration: Ik Dyos Gado Nij Daar(i) Teer|| Saj(i) Suddh Saaj Nij An Beer||
translation: One day, this mighty ruler, bedecking himself, went to his wife,

gurmukhi: ikh BwNq su qiRX mo BXo inrukq ]qb BXo dust ko bIrj mukq ]3]
transliteration: Kih Bhaant Su Triya Mo Bhayo Niroukt|| Tab Bhayo Doust Ko Beeraj Moukt||3||
translation: And absorbed himself with her so intensely that at the time of his intercourse, his semen was discharged.3.

gurmukhi: pHlwd Bgq lIno vqwr sB krin kwj sMqn auDwr ]
transliteration: Prahlaad Bhagad Leeno Vataar|| Sabh Karan(i) Kaaj Santan Udhaar||
translation: From that semen Prahlad was born in order to help nad protect the saints.

gurmukhi: ctswr pVn saupXo niRpwl ]ptIXih kihXo ilKdY gupwl ]4]
transliteration: Chatsaar Padan Saoupyo Nripaal|| Pateeyah(i) Kahiyo Likhdai Goupaal||4||
translation: When the king sent him to school for education, he asked his teacher to write the Name of Lord-God on his tablet.4.

gurmukhi: ieik dXos gXo ctswr niRpM ]icq cOk rihXo suB dyK suqM ]
transliteration: Ik(i) Dyos Gado Chatsaar Nripan|| Chit Chaouk Rahiyo Soubh Dekh Soutan||
translation: One day the king went to the school and seeing his son, he was startled.

gurmukhi: ju pVXo idj qy suin qwih rVo ]inrBY iss nwmu gupwl pVo ]5]
transliteration: Ju Daryo Dij Te Soun(i) Rado|| Nirbhai Sis Naam(u) Goupaal Pado||5||
translation: When the king asked, the child told whatever he had learnt and fearlessly began to read the Name of Lord-God.5.
